extraction_details.evidence: Use of lucicebtide (ST101) in glioblastoma patients by antagonism of C/EBPβ-dependent mesenchymal cell transition

Lucicebtide.reasoning: The abstract title explicitly identifies lucicebtide as an antagonist of C/EBPβ. Following Rule 1, since the drug class is mentioned in the abstract title, it is prioritized over all other sources. Following Rule 3, Rule 11, and Rule 13, the target and modality are formatted as 'C/EBPβ Antagonist' using Title Case and the specific target mentioned.
